title: Social Media Redirect Scam
context: Someone follows you on Instagram with an attractive profile and lots of followers. They start messaging you and seem really interested.

steps.text: Hey gorgeous! Love your photos. I don't check IG much though. Can we chat on WhatsApp instead? All the cool people are using it now ðŸ˜˜
They want to move the conversation to WhatsApp and are pushing for more personal photos. What's your next move?

choices.text: Suggest staying on Instagram for now
Look more carefully at their profile first

steps.text: This is a setup for sextortion! Scammers use attractive fake profiles with high follower counts (social proof) to seem legitimate, then move conversations to private apps.
steps.explanation: Moving to WhatsApp removes the conversation from the platform's safety features. They'll eventually ask for intimate photos to blackmail you with.

items.question: Why do scammers want to move conversations off the original platform?
What should make you suspicious of a new social media follower?

options.text: They have very few posts but many followers
They live in a different city
